pullRequest.title: DEV-1555 Print failure logs at the end of pipeline
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adds a field to the stage outputs to cache a reference to the log blob in case of failure.
Little awkward as we need to explicitly add the log everywhere, but can't find another solution
with the current state of the StageOutputs. The lanes in the BwaAligner also make it a bit
tricky to make a really general solution.

commit.message:
DEV-1555 Print failure logs at the end of pipeline

Adds a field to the stage outputs to cache a reference to the log blob in case of failure.

Little awkward as we need to explicitly add the log everywhere, but can't find another solution
with the current state of the StageOutputs. The lanes in the BwaAligner also make it a bit
tricky to make a really general solution.

nodes.bodyText: I can see the reasoning (it's a summary showing any failures) but it's not necessarily a failure. Could we call it StageSummary or ExecutionSummary or something similar?
I thought we had a requirement that it live in the top-level?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -50,7 +50,7 @@ String asUnixString(StorageStrategy storageStrategy) {
                 "function die() {",
                 "  exit_code=$?",
                 "  echo \"Unknown failure: called command returned $exit_code\"",
-                format("  gsutil -m cp %s gs://%s", localLogFile, runtimeBucketName),
+                format("  gsutil -m cp %s gs://%s/results/", localLogFile, runtimeBucketName),

commit.message:
DEV-1555 Print failure logs at the end of pipeline

Change to use pointers to GCS locations rather than the actual blobs, as in some cases the
blob won't yet exist when the output is created. Also now explicit that the pointers are only
for logs of failed stages.

Also addressing review feedback:
- Better name for summary class
- Remove change to bash script
- Remove accidental commit to OverriddenReferenceGenome
